question: Natural methods work on the principle of avoiding chances of ______ and sperms meeting.
Periodic abstinence is a method in which couples avoid coitus from day ______ to 17 of the menstrual cycle.

The period from day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle is called the ______ period.
Withdrawal method is also known as coitus ______.
In the withdrawal method, the male partner withdraws his penis just before ______.
Lactational amenorrhea means absence of ______.
Ovulation does not occur during the period of intense ______ following parturition.
Lactational amenorrhea is effective for a maximum period of ______ months following parturition.
Natural methods have almost nil ______ effects as no medicines or devices are used.
In barrier methods, ovum and sperms are prevented from physically meeting with the help of ______.
Condoms are barriers made of thin rubber or latex ______.
Condoms for males cover the ______.
Condoms for females cover the vagina and ______.
‘______’ is a popular brand of condom for the male.
Condoms also protect the user from contracting STIs and ______.
Diaphragms, cervical caps and vaults are made of ______.
Diaphragms, cervical caps and vaults cover the ______ during coitus.
Spermicidal creams, jellies and foams are used along with barriers to increase contraceptive ______.
IUDs are inserted in the uterus through the ______.
Non-medicated IUDs include ______ loop.
Copper releasing IUDs include CuT, Cu7, and ______ 375.
Hormone releasing IUDs include Progestasert and ______-20.
IUDs increase phagocytosis of ______ within the uterus.
Cu ions released from copper IUDs suppress sperm ______.
Hormone releasing IUDs make the uterus unsuitable for ______.
Hormone releasing IUDs make the cervix hostile to the ______.
IUDs are ideal contraceptives for females who want to delay ______.
IUDs are widely accepted methods of contraception in ______.
